resources.string: Track and measure your rides with great accuracy. Increase your cycling safety and efficiency.
Remove ads and unlock all non-subscription features we may add in the future
All features and maps unlocked (monthly subscription)
All features and maps unlocked (yearly subscription)
Sorry, the feature is not available on this device
Please restart the app for this to take effect
Error saving profile data! Please try again.
Could not switch the profile! Please try again.
Error saving track! Try resetting again.
Error writing track data to storage! Try resetting again.
Error zipping track! Try resetting again.
Error moving track to USB storage! Try resetting again.
FenceGuard: You are currently not inside the fence
FenceGuard: Your location still not available
Cannot delete — Profile contains some unsaved data! Please finish first.
Please turn off or pause the GPS first
Long-click to toggle the roar sound
Please fill in Power parameters in Settings
The app was licensed successfully. Thank you for your support!
Providing control of the foreground service and easy access to the app
This will load the default colors. Are you sure?
Note: Use volume buttons on your device to adjust overall sound volume.
Fence will be raised around your current location to protect it from being exposed in recorded tracks.
Fence raised around your location protects it from being exposed in recorded tracks.
Are you sure to remove the fence?
Are you sure to remove the fence %1$s?

Distance %1$.3f %2$s
Duration %3$s
(%4$s)

The track seems very short. Save this track?
Warning: Tracking is active, and will be stopped.
Warning: This will remove profile settings and totals data. Saved tracks will be left intact.\n\nDelete profile %1$s?
New profile will have its settings copied from the currently active profile
Tracking is active. Are you sure to switch to profile %1$s?
Warning: This action cannot be undone.\n\nDelete selected tracks?
Warning: This action cannot be undone.\n\nDelete the track %1$s?
Tracking is active. Please turn off or pause the GPS first.
Target profile %1$s is not blank. Please reset first.
Active profile will be switched from %1$s to %2$s. Continue?
Profile %1$s which created this track does not exist anymore. Resume in current profile %2$s?
Track will be resumed in profile %1$s. Continue?
Some error occurred. Please try again.
Some error occurred. Please try again.
Cannot share more than 100 tracks at once.

You won't be able to use most of the features of this app without Location.

Please make sure the Location is enabled and set to 'High accuracy' mode.

Open Location Settings now?
Barometric Altitude has been turned off forcibly due to discrepancy with GPS altitude!\n\nPlease do not use it in closed or air-conditioned spaces!
Barometric Altitude works only outdoors.\n\nPlease do not use it in closed or air-conditioned spaces like some vehicles and airplanes.
Thermo Barometer depends on outdoor air temperature for accuracy.\n\nPlease do not use it in closed or air-conditioned spaces like some vehicles and airplanes.
Save this track and prepare for a new one?
No track was recorded. Reset the meters now?
Open the downloads web page now?
Note: Keep this value below 3 sec to get the most accurate readings and the most consistent behaviour!
The app needs to access your location to record your outdoor activities.
Location permission is needed to find Bluetooth devices.\n\nNo Bluetooth devices will be found if the permission is rejected.

The app needs to access the storage so it can save or restore your tracks and settings.\n\nWithout giving the permission you won\'t be able to see tracks history or share tracks, and you could loose your data.
Permission is needed so the app can activate the flashlight.
This permission is needed for the app to function properly. It can be granted in the App permissions settings page.\n\nGo there now?
Connecting to a cloud service makes it easier for you to upload and share your tracks with others.\n\nWe\'ll never post anything without your permission.
Track will inherit default privacy you set on Strava
No tracks here. Go out and record an activity!
Sensor properties are managed per profile. Properties here are managed for the currently active profile only (%1$s).
Use cadence sensor to obtain speed readings, or vice versa. Normally disabled.
This will perform automatic circumference measurements during a ride.
This will perform automatic stride length measurements during a ride.
Number of triggers (e.g. magnets) used by the sensor. Sensors with no external triggers usually have a single internal trigger.
Preferences here are applicable to all profiles.
Click here if you would like to help translate this app to another language
Ring the bell on significant slowdown
Shake the device to ring the bell
Pick the desired color for the app background
Pick the desired color for the text and icons
Apply light or dark theme based on environment illumination
Screen will remain turned on while the app is used
Allow screen to turn off after several minutes of inactivity
App will remain visible even if the device is locked
(All profiles) Use proximity sensor to keep the display off while not needed
Ring the automatic bell when the speed drops to zero, too
Disable bell ring on speedometer click
Continue producing sounds even if audio focus is lost (by system notification or another app)
Warning: Experimental, may not work. Try to reroute all sounds through the loudspeaker when headphones are connected, except the voice calls.
Lower the volume of roaring sounds when the bell rings
(All profiles) Resume tracking after a forced device reboot, if battery 10% or more
Prompt to start a new track if last active more than 4 hours ago or in distant location
Launch the App (in Passive mode) when GPS activity is detected
Enable Passive GPS mode when clicking GPS button
(All profiles) Use segmented digital LCD font for cyclometer data display
Produce alert sounds as you move
Produce constant roar sounds at all times, regardless of your movement or GPS state
Roar will sound only when going faster than the threshold speed. Useful e.g. for downhills.
Toggle constant mode with a button click while the roar is turned on
Protect the location of your home, or other important places from being exposed in recorded tracks
(All profiles) Recalculate speed from distances, do not use GPS value directly. This may provide more stable speed readings over GPS (Doppler) values.
Sound when entering or leaving a fence
Sound on GPS status change (good, bad/standstill)
Sound on countdown before resuming the track (…3, 2, 1, GO!)
Alarm will sound when significant movement is detected while tracking is paused
Chart your movements over the map
Show FenceGuard protected regions over the map
(All profiles) Turn off to reduce battery usage, especially while the Follow mode is on
Mapsforge vector (.map) and Rmaps raster (.sqlitedb) maps are supported. Available at download.mapsforge.org.\n\nUsage: Select the downloaded map file with the option above.
Warning: Some online data may be retrieved even in offline mode. Please disable mobile Internet before using maps, if concerned.
Chart selected GPX routes as dotted lines over the map
No other visual or audible cues will be given to facilitate the route navigation
(All profiles) Enable invisible quick zoom buttons in the bottom part of the map, improves your orientation
(All profiles) Render terrain elevation shades. Map will look more realistic, but probably slower. Requires DEM (.hgt) files present in the map folder.

Open up download page at viewfinderpanoramas.org.\n\nUsage: Extract .hgt files from the downloaded zip(s) and place them in the same folder where the offline map file resides (do not use separate subfolder).
(All profiles) Choose what to do when layer button gets pressed
Enable the Auto Ring mode toggle on speedometer long-click
Show the Flashlight button (if flashlight available)
Show the Contrast/Map layer toggle button
Prevents change of mode on click
Show the needle in graphic indicator
For accurate power and energy readings, please make sure these parameters are correct!
Generate SVG graph data files for various ride parameters
Use proximity sensor to keep the flashlight off while not needed
Toggle flickering mode with a button click while the flashlight is turned on
Indicates aging of the speed value, as it becomes more uncertain with time
Shows when you are going faster or slower than the average speed
Use inbuilt barometer to enhance altitude accuracy
Use temperature sensor data for more accurate barometric altitudes
Use these only in the open atmosphere! Please disable while in pressurized, closed or air-conditioned vehicles like cars or airplanes!
This device lacks ambient temperature sensor, but it can be derived using other sensors. Please read more in Help.
Works best for Samsung, LG, Sony (regular), Xiaomi, and the like
Works best for Motorola, HTC, Sony (compact), and the like
This constant is added to barometer readouts and can be used to mitigate barometer bias, if present
Show app notification icon in system status bar at all times, not only when tracking is active.
When viewing a map, both online and offline, parts are being cached locally to reduce the need for repeated download or recreation. This speeds up map loading and saves battery. (All profiles)
This will acquire data only from wireless sensors (Power, Speed, Cadence, Heart rate) and will not turn on the GPS
Total distance traveled since first profile use.
Duration of the trip, possibly excluding any pauses or stops.
Elapsed time, including all pauses but excluding stops.
Energy spent for the trip, taking efficiency and BMR into account.
Part of the energy spent that would suffice to make the same trip by moving at a constant speed equal to the average speed. Higher is better.
Measure of route deviation from a straight line, i.e. how much it fills the area instead of going straight. Lower is usually better.
Height above mean sea level (geoid) — Current, Maximum and Minimum.\n\nPlease note: This can be delayed from the real time, due to inevitable digital filtering delays.

Slope (gradient), a number describing terrain tilt where zero is horizontal. Higher number means steeper ascent, and negative is for descent.\n\nPlease note: This can be delayed from the real time by a minute or so, due to inevitable digital filtering delays.
Speed in the up (positive) or down (negative) direction — Current, Maximum and Minimum.\n\nPlease note: This can be delayed from the real time, due to inevitable digital filtering delays.
Inverse speed — Current, Maximum and Average.
Rate of change of speed — Current, Maximum and Minimum.\n\nNegative means deceleration.

Power exerted due to drag forces, altitude change, etc. — Current, Maximum and Average.

Negative means power gain, e.g. when going downhill or braking.

When in kcal/h or kJ/h, it also takes efficiency and BMR into account.

Please note: This can be delayed from the real time by a minute or so, due to inevitable digital filtering delays.

Average power exerted during activity, not counting intervals where power was absent or really small (downhill, braking, coasting).\n\nWhen doing a strenuous workout, this will basically be your FTP (Functional Threshold Power).

Power loss or gain while ascending or descending — Current, Maximum and Minimum.

Negative means power gain (descending).

When in kcal/h or kJ/h, it also takes efficiency into account.

Please note: This can be delayed from the real time by a minute or so, due to inevitable digital filtering delays.
Ambient temperature measured with the device — Current, Maximum and Minimum.
Ambient pressure measured with the device — Current, Maximum and Minimum.
Number of revolutions of the crank per minute, i.e. pedalling rate.
Ratio of wheel revolutions vs. pedal turns per time unit, i.e. ratio of front sprocket and rear sprocket sizes. Higher number means higher gear.
Note: Auto Pause forced to Relaxed
Note: Auto Pause forced to Off

string-array.name: pref_gps_boost_modes_explanation
string-array.item: Force frequent GPS updates while the map is visible
Force frequent GPS updates while the screen is turned on

string-array.name: pref_autopause_modes_explanation
string-array.item: Discard all pauses longer than few seconds
Discard only pauses longer than 5 minutes

string-array.name: pref_wakelock_modes_explanation
string-array.item: Automatically decide based on GPS update interval and other factors
Keep CPU awake during tracking. May use more battery, but ensures no location update is skipped.
Allow CPU to sleep between location updates. May use less battery, but may skip an update on a rare occasion.
Obey behaviour imposed by the system and/or other apps. Warning: May cause highly irregular location updates or even reject them all. Not recommended.

string-array.name: pref_locationProvider_modes_explanation
string-array.item: (All profiles) Use GPS subsystem directly. Stable, less complex model, no middleman. May also use less resources than the other provider.
(All profiles) Use \"Fused\" provider from Google Play services, if available. In theory this may provide faster and more accurate locations sometimes. Try it out to see if it benefits you.

string-array.name: pref_hud_axis_entries
string-array.item: Default — Statusbar at its natural position
Upside down — More practical device handling

resources.string: This activity was tracked using Urban Biker mobile app
Thanks! Please write a nice review or rate us 5 stars on the Play Store.
Urban Biker should be exempt from battery optimizations, otherwise it may not work properly.\n\nOpen Settings now?
Select Urban Biker from the list
Some error occurred. Please try again.
